newsitem.title: USA: Internet Service Providers form operators group.
newsitem.headline: Internet Service Providers form operators group.

text.p: Nine Internet service providers (ISPs) said Tuesday they formed IOPS.ORG, a group of ISPs committed to make the commercial Internet more reliable.
IOPS.ORG will focus on resolving and preventing network integrity problems, especially those requiring technical coordination and information exchange among ISPs.

The founding members are ANS Communications, AT&T Corp, BBN Corp, EarthLink Network Inc, GTE Corp, MCI Communications Corp, NETCOM On-Line Communications Inc, PSINet Inc and UUNET, a unit of WorldCom Inc.

"IOPS.ORG will play a key role in the healthy technical and operational evolution of the Internet as an increasingly important component of the economy," said Robert Kahn, president of the Corporation for National Research Initiatives (CNRI), a non-profit organization that will host the initial operations of IOPS.ORG.
"We're fully behind IOPS.ORG. It will be a very useful organization to help steer the growth of the Internet," said Paul Gudonis, president of BBN Planet.
"IOPS is an organization whose time has come," said Vint Cerf Sr, MCI's vice president for Internet architecture and engineering.

"As the Internet continues its rapid evolution and growth as a new global telecommunications infrastructure, the collection of Internet Service Providers needs increasing amounts of coordinated effort to sustain worldwide quality of service," he said.
